etymologies: late Middle English: probably a shortening of obsolete martinet, from French, probably from St Martin of Tours, celebrated at Martinmas

definitions: a swift-flying insectivorous songbird of the swallow family, typically having a less strongly forked tail than a swallow.

notes.text: Family Hirundinidae: several genera and numerous species, e.g., the purple martin

shortDefinitions: swift-flying insectivorous songbird of swallow family
